Class BudgetAnalysisManager

java.lang.Object
financialManagement.BudgetAnalysisManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class BudgetAnalysisManager extends Object implements Serializable
Manages the analysis and tracking of a user's budget, categories, expenses, and transactions. Provides functionality for adding new categories and expenses, as well as tracking and analyzing expenses and transactions.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    BudgetAnalysisManager()
    Constructs a new BudgetAnalysisManager and initializes the lists of categories, expenses, transactions, and incomes.

  • Constructor Details

    • BudgetAnalysisManager

      public BudgetAnalysisManager()
      Constructs a new BudgetAnalysisManager and initializes the lists of categories, expenses, transactions, and incomes. Loads data from storage if available.

  • Method Details

    • addNewCategory

      public void addNewCategory(String categoryName, double budget)
      Adds a new category with a specified name and budget if the category doesn't already exist. The updated categories list is saved to storage after the addition.
      Parameters:
      categoryName - The name of the category to add.
      budget - The budget for the new category.

    • categoryExists

      public boolean categoryExists(String name)
      Checks if a category exists in the current list of categories.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the category to check.
      Returns:
      true if the category exists, false otherwise.

    • getCategoryByName

      public Category getCategoryByName(String categoryName)
      Retrieves a category by its name.
      Parameters:
      categoryName - The name of the category to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The category with the specified name, or null if no such category exists.

    • addNewExpense

      public void addNewExpense(String description, String categoryName, double amount)
      Adds a new expense with a description, category, and amount if the category exists and the expense is not already entered. The updated expenses list is saved to storage after the addition.
      Parameters:
      description - The description of the expense.
      categoryName - The category of the expense.
      amount - The amount of the expense.

    • spentManager

      public void spentManager()
      Analyzes and prints the budget status by comparing the amount spent in each category with the budget. Displays whether the category is over or under budget.

    • trackExpenses

      public void trackExpenses()
      Displays a list of all expenses.

    • trackTransactions

      public void trackTransactions()
      Displays a list of all transactions.

    • trackIncomes

      public void trackIncomes()
      Displays a list of all incomes.
